Prepare a monthly budget: Income Rs 45,000. Expenses: Rent 12,000; Food 8,500; Transport 2,500; School fees 3,500; Utilities 2,000; Misc 3,800; Savings target 20% of income. Find actual savings and compare with target. [SSC 2020]
answer:
Target savings = 20% of 45,000 = Rs 9,000.
Sum of listed expenses = 12,000 + 8,500 + 2,500 + 3,500 + 2,000 + 3,800 = Rs 32,300.
Actual savings = Income − Expenses = 45,000 − 32,300 = Rs 12,700.
Comparison: Actual (12,700) − Target (9,000) = Rs 3,700 more than target.

text: GST invoice (intra-state): List price Rs 36,000, trade discount 15%, packing charges Rs 600, GST 18%. Find (i) taxable value, (ii) CGST and SGST, (iii) invoice total. [SSC 2021]
answer:
Discounted price = 36,000 × 0.85 = Rs 30,600.
Add packing (taxable) = 30,600 + 600 = Rs 31,200 (taxable value).
GST @ 18% = 31,200 × 18% = 5,616 ⇒ CGST 2,808 and SGST 2,808.
Invoice total = 31,200 + 5,616 = Rs 36,816.

text: Shares & Dividend: Bought 100 shares at market value Rs 120 each; face value Rs 10; company declares 15% dividend. Find (i) total dividend, (ii) yield on investment (percentage). [SSC 2019]
answer:
Dividend is on face value: per share = 15% of 10 = Rs 1.5.
Total dividend = 100 × 1.5 = Rs 150.
Investment = 100 × 120 = Rs 12,000.
Yield % = (Dividend / Investment) × 100 = (150 / 12,000) × 100 = 1.25%.
